title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
text: psem implements Proxy Spectral Error Model described discussion papers: spectral approach estimating timescale-dependent uncertainty paleoclimate records – Part : Theoretical concept. https://doi.org/10.5194/cp-16-1469-2020 spectral approach estimating timescale-dependent uncertainty paleoclimate records – Part II: Application interpretation. https://cp.copernicus.org/preprints/cp-2019-153/ Please contact Dr Andrew Dolman <andrew.dolman@awi.de>, Prof. Thomas Laepple <tlaepple@awi.de>, Dr Torben Kunz <tkunz@awi.de>, Alfred-Wegener-Institute, Helmholtz Centre Polar Marine Research, Germany, information. work supported German Federal Ministry Education Research (BMBF) Research Sustainability initiative FONA PalMod project (FKZ: 01LP1509C).

title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
text: psem can installed directly github

title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
what: Power spectrum for the stochastic climate
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
code: # PSD Climate example.lat <- 45  clim.spec.ex1 <- ModelSpectrum(   freq = NULL,   latitude = example.lat,   variable = "temperature", beta = 1 )  p.clim.spec.ex1 <- PlotModelSpectrum(clim.spec.ex1) p.clim.spec.ex1

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
code: seasonal.amp <- AmpFromLocation(   longitude = 0,   latitude = example.lat,   proxy.type = "degC",   depth.upr = 0, depth.lwr = -50 )  ## Returning for closest available coordinates: longitude = -0.5, latitude = 44.5

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
what: Orbital modulation of the amplitude of the seasonal cycle
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
code: orbital.pars <- RelativeAmplitudeModulation(   latitude = example.lat,   maxTimeKYear = 23,   minTimeKYear = 1,   bPlot = FALSE )

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
code: # sediment accumulation rate for the core ex.sed.acc.rate <- 10  spec.pars.ex1 <- GetSpecPars(   proxy.type = "Mg_Ca",   T = 1e04,   delta_t = 100,   tau_r = 100,   sig.sq_a = orbital.pars$sig.sq_a,   sig.sq_c = seasonal.amp$sig.sq_c,   tau_b = 1000 * 10 / ex.sed.acc.rate,   tau_s = 1000 * 1 / ex.sed.acc.rate,   N = 30,   tau_p = 7/12,   phi_c = 0, delta_phi_c = 2 * pi / 3,   phi_a = pi / 2,   sigma.cal = 0.25,   sigma.meas = 0.25,   sigma.ind = 1,   clim.spec.fun = "ModelSpectrum",   clim.spec.fun.args =     list(latitude = example.lat, beta = 1) )

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
what: Call ProxyErrorSpectrum with these parameters and plot it.
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.
code: proxy.err.spec <- do.call(ProxyErrorSpectrum, spec.pars.ex1) PlotSpecError(proxy.err.spec)  ## Joining, by = c("component", "ax.grp")  ## geom_path: Each group consists of only one observation. Do you need to adjust ## the group aesthetic?

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
what: Integrate the error spectrum to get timescale-dependent error.
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.

previous_headings: Usage > Parametrise a proxy error spectrum for a core at 45°N 0°E
what: Get error for a record smoothed to a given timescale, here 500 years.
title: PSEM: Proxy Spectral Error Model.

title: Expected correlation between replicate proxy records and between a proxy record and the true climate — ExpectedCorrelation
Expected correlation between replicate proxy records and between a proxy record and the true climate — ExpectedCorrelation
text: pes Object class proxy.error.spec, e.g. output ProxyErrorSpectrum spec.pars Parameters proxy error spectrum, taken proxy.error.spec proxy.error.spec object. Can passed allow calculation compatible none proxy.error.spec objects.

title: Expected correlation between replicate proxy records and between a proxy record and the true climate — ExpectedCorrelation
text: data.frame / tibble

title: Expected correlation between replicate proxy records and between a proxy record and the true climate — ExpectedCorrelation
code: spec.pars <- GetSpecPars("Mg_Ca", tau_b = 1000 * 10 / 2, sigma.meas = 1) spec.obj <- do.call(ProxyErrorSpectrum, spec.pars) #> Warning: Rounding T to 10100 so that T is an odd integer multiple of delta_t  exp.corr <- ExpectedCorrelation(spec.obj) plot(rho~smoothed.resolution, data = exp.corr, type = "l", log = "x")

title: Get error from proxy.error.var object — GetProxyError
code: spec.pars <- GetSpecPars("Mg_Ca", tau_p = 1 / 12, phi_c = 0, seas.amp = 4, T = 100 * 101) spec.obj <- do.call(ProxyErrorSpectrum, spec.pars) #> Warning: Rounding T to 10100 so that T is an odd integer multiple of delta_t PlotSpecError(spec.obj) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Joining, by = c("component", "ax.grp") #> Warning: Transformation introduced infinite values in continuous y-axis #> geom_path: Each group consists of only one observation. Do you need to adjust #> the group aesthetic?  var.obj <- IntegrateErrorSpectra(spec.obj) PlotTSDVariance(var.obj) #> Warning: Removed 8 rows containing missing values (position_stack).  GetProxyError(var.obj, timescale = 100) #>    smoothed.resolution            component       f.zero  inc.f.zero #> 1                  100    Aliasing.seasonal 0.0003928943 0.003948539 #> 2                  100  Aliasing.stochastic 0.0251216653 0.252469612 #> 3                  100         Bioturbation 0.0000000000 0.525258573 #> 4                  100     Calibration.unc. 0.3000000000 0.300000000 #> 5                  100 Individual.variation 0.0273861279 0.275227179 #> 6                  100           Meas.error 0.0260000000 0.261296766 #> 7                  100    Reference.climate           NA 0.927987688 #> 8                  100        Seasonal.bias 1.9772250389 1.980631450 #> 9                  100   Seasonal.bias.unc. 0.0000000000 0.000000000 #> 10                 100          Total.error 2.0003689927 2.120514090 #>     exl.f.zero #> 1  0.003928943 #> 2  0.251216653 #> 3  0.525258573 #> 4  0.000000000 #> 5  0.273861279 #> 6  0.260000000 #> 7           NA #> 8  0.116112383 #> 9  0.000000000 #> 10 0.703636197

title: Integrate Error Spectra — IntegrateErrorSpectra
text: Integrates error spectra get variance(s) optionally filters simulate case running mean passed proxy record.

title: Integrate Error Spectra — IntegrateErrorSpectra
code: IntegrateErrorSpectra(   pes,   method = "sincfilter",   tau_smooth = NULL,   thin.tau_smooth = TRUE )

title: Integrate Error Spectra — IntegrateErrorSpectra
text: pes Object class proxy.error.spec, e.g. output ProxyErrorSpectrum method sinc filter currently supported method tau_smooth temporal resolution proxy timeseries smoothed.  NULL, variance returned odd multiples delta_t thin.tau_smooth TRUE vector tau_smooth values longer 1000, thinned 1000 values equally spaced log-scale

title: Integrate Error Spectra — IntegrateErrorSpectra
text: timescale dependent variance object (dataframe)

title: Integrate Error Spectra — IntegrateErrorSpectra
code: spec.pars <- GetSpecPars("Mg_Ca", tau_p = 1 / 12, phi_c = 0, seas.amp = 4, T = 100 * 101) spec.obj <- do.call(ProxyErrorSpectrum, spec.pars) #> Warning: Rounding T to 10100 so that T is an odd integer multiple of delta_t PlotSpecError(spec.obj, show.low.power.panel = FALSE) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Joining, by = c("component", "ax.grp") #> Warning: Transformation introduced infinite values in continuous y-axis #> geom_path: Each group consists of only one observation. Do you need to adjust #> the group aesthetic?  var.obj <- IntegrateErrorSpectra(spec.obj) PlotTSDVariance(var.obj) #> Warning: Removed 8 rows containing missing values (position_stack).   var.obj <- IntegrateErrorSpectra(spec.obj, tau_smooth = 1000)

what:
Create a model SST spectrum based on the observed spectra and a
  powerlaw spectrum — ModelSpectrum
title:
Create a model SST spectrum based on the observed spectra and a
  powerlaw spectrum — ModelSpectrum
text: Create model SST spectrum based observed spectra   powerlaw spectrum

title:
Create a model SST spectrum based on the observed spectra and a
  powerlaw spectrum — ModelSpectrum
code: ModelSpectrum(   freq = NULL,   latitude,   spectable = psem:::spectable,   beta = 1,   variable = c("temperature", "d18O", "T_deg_Mg_Ca", "T_deg_Uk37"),   freq.match.lower = 0.03,   freq.match.upper = 0.1,   bPlot = FALSE )

title:
Create a model SST spectrum based on the observed spectra and a
  powerlaw spectrum — ModelSpectrum
text: freq desired frequency vector latitude latitude degN spectable lookup table spectra latitude list(spec[iLat,iFreq],lat[iLat],freq[iFreq]) beta desired scaling variable climate variable return power spectrum, currently temperature d18O freq.match.lower lower frequency boundary variance matched spectrum switched instrumental powerlaw (default 0.03 lowest reliable estimate instrumental record given detrending multitaper bias) freq.match.upper higher frequency boundary variance matched (default 0.1 = decadal) bPlot TRUE = provide diagnostic plot

title:
Create a model SST spectrum based on the observed spectra and a
  powerlaw spectrum — ModelSpectrum
text: model spectrum list(spec,freq)

what: Get the orbital error components — OrbitalError
title: Get the orbital error components — OrbitalError
text: Get orbital error components

title: Get the orbital error components — OrbitalError
code: OrbitalError(   nu = NULL,   tau_s,   tau_b,   tau_p,   delta_t,   T,   sig.sq_c,   phi_c,   delta_phi_c,   nu_c,   sig.sq_a,   phi_a,   nu_a,   N )

title: Get the orbital error components — OrbitalError
text: nu frequency tau_s sediment slice thickness years (layer.width / sedimentation rate) tau_b timescale bioturbation (bioturbation depth / sedimentation rate) (L/sr) tau_p length proxy carrier "growth season" (< 12 months) delta_t sampling frequency sediment core / climate timeseries T length finite time series, e.g. 1e04 sig.sq_c variance seasonal cycle phi_c phase carrier growth season relative maximum seasonal cycle delta_phi_c Uncertainty phase signal carrier production. value 0 2Pi. nu_c 1/1 (yr) = frequency seasonal cycle sig.sq_a variance precessionary amplitude modulation phi_a phase precessionary amplitude modulation relative centre finite timeseries length T nu_a 1/tau_a = frequency orbital variation, e.g. precession 1/23e03 yrs N number signal carriers (e.g. individual foraminifera)

title: Get the orbital error components — OrbitalError
text: list frequency domain time domain error components

title: Get the orbital error components — OrbitalError

title: Plot Time-scale Dependent Variance Object. — PlotTSDVariance
text: Plot Time-scale Dependent Variance Object.

title: Plot Time-scale Dependent Variance Object. — PlotTSDVariance
code: PlotTSDVariance(   var.obj,   components = c("Bioturbation", "Seasonal.bias", "Seasonal.bias.unc.",     "Calibration.unc.", "Aliasing.seasonal", "Aliasing.stochastic",     "Individual.variation", "Meas.error"),   include = TRUE,   include.constant.errors = FALSE,   units = c("degC", "d18O"),   thin.var.obj = TRUE )

title: Plot Time-scale Dependent Variance Object. — PlotTSDVariance
text: var.obj Object class proxy.error.var, e.g. output IntegrateErrorSpectra components error components include exclude include Include exclude components named components include.constant.errors Include constant (nu = 0) error components units units degC d18O, used axis labelling thin.var.obj TRUE variance object contains 1000 frequencies thinned 1000 frequencies equally spaced log-scale

title: Plot Time-scale Dependent Variance Object. — PlotTSDVariance
text: ggplot object

title: Plot Time-scale Dependent Variance Object. — PlotTSDVariance
code: spec.pars <- GetSpecPars("Mg_Ca", delta_phi_c = pi) spec.obj <- do.call(ProxyErrorSpectrum, spec.pars) #> Warning: Rounding T to 10100 so that T is an odd integer multiple of delta_t  var.obj <- IntegrateErrorSpectra(spec.obj) PlotTSDVariance(var.obj, units = "degC") #> Warning: Removed 8 rows containing missing values (position_stack).  PlotTSDVariance(var.obj, units = "d18O") #> Warning: Removed 8 rows containing missing values (position_stack).  PlotTSDVariance(var.obj, include = FALSE, c("Seasonal.bias", "Calibration.unc.")) #> Warning: Removed 6 rows containing missing values (position_stack).  PlotTSDVariance(var.obj, include.constant.error = TRUE) #> Warning: Removed 8 rows containing missing values (position_stack).

title: Power Spectral Density of the Error in a Sediment Archived Proxy Timeseries — ProxyErrorSpectrum
code: ProxyErrorSpectrum(   nu = NULL,   tau_s,   tau_b,   tau_p,   tau_r,   T,   delta_t,   N,   n.k,   clim.spec.fun,   clim.spec.fun.args,   sig.sq_a,   sig.sq_c,   nu_a,   nu_c,   phi_a,   phi_c,   delta_phi_c,   sigma.meas,   sigma.ind,   sigma.cal,   n.nu.prime = 1000,   ... )

title: Power Spectral Density of the Error in a Sediment Archived Proxy Timeseries — ProxyErrorSpectrum
text: nu frequency tau_s sediment slice thickness years (layer.width / sedimentation rate) tau_b timescale bioturbation (bioturbation depth / sedimentation rate) (L/sr) tau_p length proxy carrier "growth season" (< 12 months) tau_r width moving average filter represents "interpreted" resolution timeseries T length finite time series, e.g. 1e04 delta_t sampling frequency sediment core / climate timeseries N number signal carriers (e.g. individual foraminifera) n.k number aliasers used estimating error spectrum  stochastic climate signal. Defaults 15, normally need  adjusted. clim.spec.fun function return climate power spectral density function frequency, nu clim.spec.fun.args arguments named climate power spectrum function sig.sq_a variance precessionary amplitude modulation sig.sq_c variance seasonal cycle nu_a 1/tau_a = frequency orbital variation, e.g. precession 1/23e03 yrs nu_c 1/1 (yr) = frequency seasonal cycle phi_a phase precessionary amplitude modulation relative centre finite timeseries length T phi_c phase carrier growth season relative maximum seasonal cycle delta_phi_c Uncertainty phase signal carrier production. value 0 2Pi. sigma.meas standard deviation per sample measurement error sigma.ind standard deviation error individuals (e.g. foraminifera) e.g. due "vital effects" calcification depth sigma.cal 1-sigma (standard deviation) calibration error units proxy n.nu.prime number discrete frequencies evaluate PSD error

title: Power Spectral Density of the Error in a Sediment Archived Proxy Timeseries — ProxyErrorSpectrum
text: dataframe frequencies spectral power

title: Power Spectral Density of the Error in a Sediment Archived Proxy Timeseries — ProxyErrorSpectrum
code: spec.pars <- GetSpecPars("Mg_Ca", tau_p = 4 / 12, delta_phi_c = pi) spec.obj <- do.call(ProxyErrorSpectrum, spec.pars) #> Warning: Rounding T to 10100 so that T is an odd integer multiple of delta_t PlotSpecError(spec.obj) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Joining, by = c("component", "ax.grp") #> Warning: Transformation introduced infinite values in continuous y-axis #> geom_path: Each group consists of only one observation. Do you need to adjust #> the group aesthetic?

title:
Return the fraction of the orbital variations in the seasonal

text: Thomas Laepple

title:
Return the fraction of the orbital variations in the seasonal
amplitude relative to the mean seasonal amplitude — RelativeAmplitudeModulation
code: RelativeAmplitudeModulation(34) #> $mean.amp #> [1] 303.4541 #>  #> $max.amp #> [1] 348.3554 #>  #> $min.amp #> [1] 257.7186 #>  #> $relOrbitalAmplitude #> [1] 0.2986839 #>  #> $relOrbitalMean #> [1] 0.2570214 #>  #> $sig_a #> [1] 0.1046287 #>  #> $sig.sq_a #> [1] 0.01094716 #>  if (FALSE) { library(dplyr) library(tidyr) df <- crossing(lat = seq(-90, 90, by = 10), maxT = c(23, 100, 1000)) %>% group_by(lat, maxT) %>%   mutate(sig_a = RelativeAmplitudeModulation(lat, maxTimeKYear = maxT, minTimeKYear = 0)$sig_a) %>%   ungroup() %>%   mutate(A_a = sig_a * sqrt(2))   df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = lat, y = A_a)) +   geom_line(aes(colour = factor(maxT)))   df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = lat, y = sig_a^2)) +   geom_line(aes(colour = factor(maxT)))   df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = lat, y = sig_a)) +   geom_line(aes(colour = factor(maxT))) }

Defaults 15, normally need  adjusted. clim.spec.fun function return climate power spectral density function frequency, nu clim.spec.fun.args arguments named climate power spectrum function n.nu.prime number discrete frequencies evaluate PSD error plot.integral Plot PSD error bioturbated climate timeseries. PSD numerically integrated give variance aliasing climate variation.

title: Regularise and smooth an irregular timeseries. — SmoothIrregular
code: SmoothIrregular(df, time.var, value.var, tau_smooth, d_t = NULL)

title: Regularise and smooth an irregular timeseries. — SmoothIrregular
text: df dataframe columns ages values time.var quoted string giving name age column value.var quoted string giving name value column tau_smooth Width boxcar / uniform smoothing window d_t Difference time steps new regular time series

title: Regularise and smooth an irregular timeseries. — SmoothIrregular
code: set.seed(20191205) n <- 100 dat <- data.frame(time = sort(runif(n, 1, 1e04)),  value = arima.sim(list(ar = 0.9), n = n)  ) plot(dat, type = "b") dat.smoothed <- SmoothIrregular(dat, "time", "value", tau_smooth = 500) dat.smoothed.2 <- SmoothIrregular(dat, "time", "value", tau_smooth = 500,  d_t = 500) lines(mean.value~age, data = dat.smoothed, col = "Red") lines(mean.value~age, data = dat.smoothed.2, col = "Blue")  head(dat.smoothed) #>        age mean.value n  mean.d_t tau_smooth #> 1 194.0280   1.971426 1 500.00000        500 #> 2 291.0419   1.751131 2 250.00000        500 #> 3 388.0559   1.976105 4 125.00000        500 #> 4 485.0699   1.976105 4 125.00000        500 #> 5 582.0839   2.221144 4 125.00000        500 #> 6 679.0978   1.843450 6  83.33333        500

Normalized sinc function — sinc
text: Return normalized non-normalized sinc function. Returns 1 x == 0  sinc(x) = sin(pi * x) / (pi * x) sinc(x) = sin(x) / (x)

title: Normalized sinc function — sinc
Normalized sinc function — sinc
text: x numeric normalized logical, return normalized non-normalized sinc function, defaults TRUE

title: Normalized sinc function — sinc
code: x <- seq(-10, 10, length.out = 1000) plot(x, sinc(x), type = "l") lines(x, sinc(x)^2, col = "Red") abline(h = 0)   x <- seq(-10, 10, length.out = 1000) plot(x, sinc(x, normalized = FALSE), type = "l") lines(x, sinc(x, normalized = FALSE)^2, col = "Red") abline(h = 0)
